definition: clear proof
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: We are all manifestations of the same life-force.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是同一生命力的明證。

sentences.english: Surely the evidence of progress is all around us?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們周圍不都是進步的明證嗎？

sentences.english: Its economy is strained; witness the ever feebler dollar.
sentences.chinese: 經濟停滯不前，美元的虛弱就是明證。

sentences.english: His finger-prints were a clear proof of his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 他的指紋就是犯罪的明證。

sentences.english: Ruth, Judy and Marcy all have their lives to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 露絲，朱蒂和馬西，她們都還活着，這就是明證。

sentences.english: The applications available today are proof of that.
sentences.chinese: 當今可用的這些應用就是明證。

sentences.english: Physics and chemistry are very few women at home, is a proof.
sentences.chinese: 數理化家們極少女性，也是一種明證。

sentences.english: The Japanese retail chain Uniqlo is a case in point.
sentences.chinese: 日本連鎖零售商優衣庫即是明證。

sentences.english: The rapid increase in wind power in the past several years is a good example for illustration.
sentences.chinese: 過去幾年風力發電的快速增長即是一個明證。

sentences.english: Eleven" Golden Week " blowout" is no better evidence of the.
sentences.chinese: “十一”黃金週的“井噴”是再好不過的明證了。

sentences.english: Its inability to sustain offensives beyond three or four days is well documented.
sentences.chinese: 其無能支撐攻勢作戰超過三到四天，是爲明證。

sentences.english: And I guess that Gabe and I are a true 5)testament to that.
sentences.chinese: 我想加布和我就是一個真實的明證了。

sentences.english: " Qin bricks and Han tiles " becoming world famous can be the evident proof.
sentences.chinese: “秦磚漢瓦”的聞名於世即是明證。

definition: famous school/noted school of thought
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
commodity economy
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
micro-/microscopic/to make the minute visible
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
subtle words with profound meaning (idiom)
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
heterogeneous
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
transition
pioneering/groundbreaking
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
loyal/sincere/sound
